content.body: that seems like precisely a proposal for releasing z̲̗̼͙̥͚͛͑̏a̦̟̳͋̄̅ͬ̌͒͟ļ̟̉͌ͪ͌̃̚g͔͇̯̜ͬ̒́o̢̹ͧͥͪͬ

it's been a pretty consistent design principle that a thing should always or never return a promise, which is why throwing in the default argument position in an async function produces a rejected Promise

m.new_content.body: it's been a pretty consistent design principle that a thing should always or never return a promise, which is why throwing in the default argument position in an async function produces a rejected Promise

content.body: I think with that proposal `fn.async()` would always return a promise, and `fn.sync()` would never return a promise
content.formatted_body: I think with that proposal fn.async() would always return a promise, and fn.sync() would never return a promise

> <@pokute:matrix.org> I've been dogfooding my TypeScript support for pipeline operator at https://github.com/Pokute/AoC2021/blob/main/4.ts . It's starting to feel crucial for me. Lacking tacit function application (`|>>`) would be an inconvenience, but the other way around, I would have so many IIAFEs.

Could you elaborate, perhaps in the Pipeline Champions room?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @pokute:matrix.org
I've been dogfooding my TypeScript support for pipeline operator at https://github.com/Pokute/AoC2021/blob/main/4.ts . It's starting to feel crucial for me. Lacking tacit function application (|>>) would be an inconvenience, but the other way around, I would have so many IIAFEs.
Could you elaborate, perhaps in the Pipeline Champions room?

content.body: Oh I see, you're saying that the current proposal (Hack, not F#) is slightly inconvienent, but if we'd gone the other way (F#, not Hack) you'd have a ton of IIAFEs which would be even worse.
Exactly. I love how easy it's write `|>> func` instead of `|> func(#)`. If I had only hack-style then I would have to write a lot of stuff in completely different ways.
content.formatted_body: Exactly. I love how easy it's write |>> func instead of |> func(#). If I had only hack-style then I would have to write a lot of stuff in completely different ways.

content.body: TabAtkins: Is the Pipeline Champions room public?
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: Is the Pipeline Champions room public?
